Model.Game

Class ServerGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • Model.Game.ServerGame

  • public class ServerGame
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the game that runs on the server. It contains a list of SocketPlayers that act as substitutes for real players. This class keeps track of everything that happens in the game: The board, the pool, the players and the score. Created by Martijn on 11-1-16.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Board board
      The Board associated with this game.
      private SocketPlayer currentPlayer
      The player whose turn it currently is.
      private java.util.List<SocketPlayer> players
      The players that participate in this game.
      private Pool pool
      The Pool associated with this game.

        public void play()
        This methods controls the game until the game is over.

      • madeTradeMove

        public void madeTradeMove(java.lang.String player,
                 int[] move)
        This method is called when a TradeMove is made with the player that made the move and the move itself as an int array as parameters. It sets the corresponding SocketPlayer's currentMove to the move that was made.
        Parameters:
        player - The player that made the move.
        move - The move that was made.

      • madePutMove

        public void madePutMove(java.lang.String player,
               java.util.List<int[]> move)
        This method is called when a PutMove is made with the player that made the move and the move itself as a list of int arrays as parameters. It sets the corresponding SocketPlayer's currentMove to the move that was made. The move should be constructed as follows: move[i]: {X-coordinate, Y-coordinate, Tile's ID}
        Parameters:
        player - The player that made the move.
        move - The move that was made.

      • gameOver

        public boolean gameOver()
        Checks whether the game is over according to the game's rules. A game is over when - There are no longer any possible moves. - The pool is empty and at least one player's hand is also empty.
        Returns:
        True if the game is over according to the game's rules.
